page.title: 14BOROUGH FARM, PULBOROUGH
page.content: On a hill 306 feet above sea level stands Borough Farm House. The present house dates from 1899 but incorporates parts of the structure of an earlier building. From the house there are extensive views to the North Downs some twenty miles distant. In the hall of the house is a framed extract from "The Times" newspaper of 6th May, 1886 to the effect that the house and farm is for sale. It claims that "it is not to be surpassed by any place in the country for salubrity". The earlier part of the house contains some "Pulborough" stone, probably quarried on the farm itself. The rebuilt house contained some 17 bedrooms, some of which have been since converted into bathrooms. As late as 1948 the house had no electricity or piped water.
